clues.text: Burundi might be a good place to open a mint, as it's rich in this element that gave its name to a U.S. coin
Ilam is a tea-growing center of this mountainous country between India & Tibet
Need a good scrubbing? The volcanic islands of American Samoa are rich in this porous rock
Botswana has some of the world's largest "pipes" of these, the country's major economic resource
You'll find plenty of bananas & coffee in this largest Central American country by area
"Hamlet" uses this verb meaning to talk nonsense; adding -ish to it makes it a nonsense language
These homophones, 1 from Genesis & 1 not, both mean a confused assortment of sounds
This rhyming phrase for meaningless ritual ends with the name of an elephant owned by P.T. Barnum
On Pentecost, the apostles received this ability AKA glossolalia that may baffle some onlookers
Change the first 3 letters in "jumbled" to get this word for a message that's so jumbled its meaning is lost
With its main store at Broadway & 12th Street, Strand Books in this city boasts "18 miles of books"
The square in Square Books is in this Mississippi college town where William Faulkner lived
Co-founded in S.F. by Lawrence Ferlinghetti, this bookstore says it was the first to sell only paperbacks
The Grolier Poetry Bookshop in this eggheaded city in the Boston metro area dates from 1927
Calling itself "the world's largest independent bookstore", this store was once a Portland, Ore. car dealership
They're close allies; it's said that "politics makes strange" ones
Politicians draw us in with "my fellow Americans" to open a speech, like this 1952 one in which Nixon rejected talk of corruption
AKA Poputchiks, fellow travelers were writers Leon Trotsky considered to be neutral about this 1917
Someone with "FRS" after his name is a fellow of this British science group
This slain IRA head known as "The Big Fellow" was played on film by big fellow Liam Neeson
This queen arrives in Jerusalem packing spices, gold & gems & sets out to test the wisdom of King Solomon
In Luke 2 Simeon tells her that her "child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel"
This festival honors Esther, a Jewish queen of Persia who saved Jews from the plotting of the evil Haman
Hannah was the mother of this judge & prophet with a first & second book to his name
In Acts, after Tabitha dies, this early Christian leader brings her back to life
With Tim Rice, "Don't Cry For Me Argentina"
Of the score for "Jurassic Park"
Of "Fig Leaf Rag" & "The Ragtime Dance"
Of "If I Could Turn Back Time" & "Because You Loved Me", this woman
Of the song "Weird Science" & the music for the "Fifty Shades" movies
Unlike his predecessors, Maximilian I of this empire wasn't crowned by the Pope
"Being unarmed...causes you to be despised", he wrote in "The Prince"
Pope Leo X was the second son of this "Magnificent" Medici
1 of the first reliefs this great artist sculpted was the "Madonna of the Stairs"
This Borgia was accused of murdering his brother Giovanni in 1497
This capital's name is derived from a dam once built on the Amstel River
The name of this Kenyan capital is Masai for "cold water"
This Honduran city is one of the few world capitals not served by a railroad
Muhammad Ali, ruler of Egypt, founded this Sudanese capital in the 1820s
From 1659 to 1862, this Romanian city was the capital of the principality of Walachia
This egg white concoction tops Baked Alaska & certain lemon pies
The pink type of this fish is nicknamed humpback for a ridge it grows before spawning
The material from which cheese is made, it's the solid part of coagulated milk
You needn't be a simpleton to enjoy this British pudding made of gooseberries & cream
This semolina-based food is the national dish of Morocco
In his "Essay on Criticism", Alexander Pope said, "To err is human, to forgive" is this
W.T. Ballard said, "You can take a boy out of" this NYC borough, "but you can never get" it "out of the boy"
Samuel Johnson said to this author, "You have but two topics, yourself and me. I am sick of both"
Mortally wounded, Capt. James Lawrence said, "Tell the men to fire faster and" don't do this
In "McCulloch v. Maryland" he said "We must never forget that it is a constitution we are expounding"
The British had more casualties in this June 17, 1775 battle near Boston than in any other of the war
clues.response: the Battle of Bunker Hill (Breed's Hill)

clues.text: In a pamphlet, he said, "The cause of America is in a great measure the cause of all mankind"
17 years after surrendering at Yorktown, this British Lord served as Viceroy of Ireland
On Jan. 10, 1779 the French gave John Paul Jones the ship Duc de Duras, which he renamed this
He beat the British in the Northwest Territory but never got paid for Army service
What we sometimes call tinfoil may be made of tin or this metal
Hg, the symbol for this metal, is derived from the Greek word "hydrargyrum". meaning "water silver"
Because of their potential toxicity, water pipes made of this metal are no longer being installed
One cubic mile of sea water contains nearly 6 million tons of this metal, symbol Mg
The most widely used stainless steel, "18-8", contains 8% nickel & 18% this plating metal

rounds.text: In 1793 he left Dublin for the United States, saying, "I expect to make a fortune" off George Washington, & he did
